#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Be a Book Worm
#Text=Love books ?
#Text=Want to learn how to love books ?
#Text=Then , start reading this handy how-to !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Visit your local library often .
#Text=The library is the heart of a true Bookworm 's soul !
#Text=Spend your leisure time visiting the library and pick up some books that you find interesting or have been acclaimed online , on the grapevine or in book reviews .
#Text=If you do n't like the sound of the book , it does n't matter !
#Text=You can always buy or borrow a different one .
#Text=Once you 've found your section , just browse through it and pick out a few books you think are interesting .
#Text=Go take a seat and read the first couple pages .
#Text=If you think it 's the perfect book , check it out and go home .
#Text=Buy , or acquire , a lot of books !
#Text=Ever heard the saying , " Never judge a book by its cover " ?
#Text=There are many online and retail book-stores , which hold mind-boggling selections of books .
#Text=Scan through a couple , and buy ones you think are interesting .
#Text=Carry/read books wherever you go .
#Text=Sure , your friends might think this is pretty dumb , but if you love books , read them a lot without worrying about others ' disapproval .
#Text=Bookworms not only collect books that they are going to read in the future , but also keep books they have already read by their beds .
#Text=In order for the book you chose to be a book you can snuggle up with you have to check these things over .
#Text=Is the book in my preferred genre / style ?
#Text=Is it too hard / easy ?
#Text=Do I like the first part of the chapter ?
#Text=After you check these things over and they 're all answered positively you are now a bookworm with the book you 've chosen ( not that you should stop with just this book , of course ) .
#Text=Find someone who loves books and literature as much as you do .
#Text=Try making or joining a book club .
#Text=Did you know that there are many online book clubs to join for free and make new friends and acquaintances ?
#Text=Try Goodreads , a social bibliophile website .
#Text=Keep it healthy .
#Text=Say you read for half an hour in the morning , half in the afternoon , and half at night .
#Text=Also read during your spare time .
#Text=Read thick books , if you 're old enough for it .
#Text=Start chapter books at about six or seven years of age .
#Text=Read series .
#Text=They 'll keep you busy if the first book is good .
#Text=If you find a book that you love and you know that you will read it over and over you should buy a copy to put on your shelf .
#Text=If you want to start writing try reading the genre that you would write e. g. : sci-fi , mystery , romance .
#Text=Keep it fun .
#Text=Reading should n't be a chore , it should be something you look forward to .
#Text=Read short version to know what is book about and then borrow it .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Never judge a book by a cover .
#Text=Just because a book 's cover may look stupid , does n't mean the book is !
#Text=Try different types of books .
#Text=Do n't stick to the same ones .
#Text=Glasses do n't make you a nerd .
#Text=If a book is n't working for you , put it down for a bit .
#Text=It 's better to read less amazing books than hundreds of bad ones .
#Text=Don´t get tired .
#Text=Read more times but for shorter time .
#Text=Talk with your friend who likes to read books .
#Text=Ask them for good book for reading .
#Text=Try reading some classic literature to expand your knowledge of books .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't become obsessed with books .
#Text=Find other hobbies , such as writing or sports !
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=A library ( or bookstore ) to visit
#Text=Someone who shares your love of books
#Text=A will/passion to read
